divs: Sighting DetailsI had started my car to let it warm up and upon exiting my vehicle, looked up and saw a single, steady, point of light approximately 65` above and about 10` West of due North, traveling in a linear motion towards the ENE at a high rate of speed. It was featureless and soundless, I ruled out the possibility of it being a commercial or civilian aircraft because of it's velocity and the absence any navigation or anti-collision lights. I cannot give an accurate estimate of it's speed or altitude, but as a frequent observer of ISS, Space Shuttle and other satellite flyovers it was easily apparent that the object was covering the sky 2.5 to 3 times faster than any orbiting vehicle I have seen before. The object easily traveled 30` in about 10 to 12 seconds.It slowly faded from view about 45` above the NE horizon.
Summary: Single point of solid light moving at high velocity.
